beautiful scenery, and
plenty of attractions.

All locks except for two are

- Some of the last cranks

- Taking a trip to the Rideau Canal

is like going through a
living history museum.
The 45 locks in 23 lockstations
have barely changed in 200 years
with the original lockmasters' houses
and blockhouses still intact.

And the locks are all cranked
the same way they were
back when the Rideau Canal opened in 1832.

It's the oldest continuously
operated canal system
in North America.

All right, we're in.
Always turn the ignition off in the locks.
